publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-302# Mr Gil Paterson: Streetlighting in Longriggend—That the Parliament views with concern the implication of the closure of HM Prison Longriggend on the people of Longriggend village and notes that following this closure in April 2000 the village will be left without maintained streetlighting or maintained roads. Supported by: Alex Neil*, Fiona McLeod*, Michael Matheson*, Linda Fabiani*, Alasdair Morgan*, Tricia Marwick*, Michael Russell*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-302# Mr Gil Paterson: Streetlighting in Longriggend—That the Parliament views with concern the implication of the closure of HM Prison Longriggend on the people of Longriggend village and notes that following this closure in April 2000 the village will be left without maintained streetlighting or maintained roads. Supported by: Alex Neil, Fiona McLeod, Michael Matheson, Linda Fabiani, Alasdair Morgan, Tricia Marwick, Michael Russell, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Donald Gorrie
S1M-302# Streetlighting in Longriggend (lodged on 18 November 1999) Andrew Wilson*, Tommy Sheridan*
